info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:34PM EDT until May 16 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CARBON AND MONROE COUNTIES... At 234 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Tannersville, or near Mount Pocono, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Palmerton, Stormville, Henryville, Brodheadsville, Werry Lake, Gilbert, Delaware Water Gap, Tannersville, Mountainhome, Alpine Mountain, Rossland, Kresgeville, Sun Valley, Jonas, Reeders, Beltzville State Park, Analomink and McMichael. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 296 and 314. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 2. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
